assignments.name: desiredStructure

nodes.name: Set Configuration
nodes.notes: Sets the root folder ID and desired folder structure.

nodes.name: Get All Folders
nodes.notes: Gets all folders accessible to the account (across drives). Build Actual Structure will filter this to only the subtree rooted at rootFolderId.

nodes.name: Build Actual Structure
nodes.notes: Converts the flat list of folders from Google Drive into a hierarchical JSON structure matching the desired format.

nodes.name: Set Missing Folders
nodes.notes: Compares desired structure with actual Google Drive structure and outputs exists flags for all folders.

nodes.name: Flatten Folders to Create
nodes.notes: Flattens the structure and filters to only folders with exists == false. Sorts by depth so parents are created before children.

nodes.name: Create Folder
nodes.notes: Creates a folder in Google Drive using the Google Drive API. Includes shared drive parameters to ensure folders are created in the shared drive, not My Drive.

parameters.content:
## Workflow Overview

This workflow creates a hierarchical folder structure in Google Drive by comparing a desired structure definition with the current Drive state.

**How it works:**
1. Fetches all folders from Google Drive and builds a hierarchical tree
2. Compares desired structure with actual structure, marking each folder with `exists: true/false`
3. Identifies folders to create: only those where `exists === false` AND their parent already exists
4. Creates folders in batches (run multiple times until all folders are created)

**Usage:** Run the workflow repeatedly until it logs "0 folders to create" - this ensures parents are created before children.
